intro: Canthium lacusvictoriae, commonly known as the Victoria Lake spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Lake Victoria region in East Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, colorful bracts. The plant typically grows in moist, swampy habitats along the shores of Lake Victoria. Its flowers are small and clustered, with the vibrant bracts serving as an attraction for pollinators. Canthium lacusvictoriae plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food and habitat for various insects and birds.
